archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Indian Feast Night
name: Lamb Shank Rogan Josh with Saffron Pulao and Kachumber
description: Slow-braised lamb shanks in a rich rogan josh sauce, served with fragrant saffron basmati pulao and a bright lemon-mint kachumber. A centerpiece Indian feast with layered aromas and medium heat.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups basmati rice until water runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Slice 2 large onions thinly; mince 6 cloves garlic.
Rinse and pat dry 4 lamb shank pieces; season lightly with salt and pepper.
Crush a pinch of saffron in 2 tablespoons warm water.
Dice 2 tomatoes and 1 cucumber; thinly slice 1/2 red onion; chop a small handful of mint.
Measure spices: 3 tablespoons rogan josh spice blend, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, 2 cardamom pods, 1 small cinnamon piece, 2 cloves, 1 bay leaf.
Set out 1 cup crushed tomatoes, 1/2 cup yoghurt, 3 cups water (for braise), 2 cups water (for rice), and 2 tablespoons ghee or oil.
cook_steps: Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a heavy oven-safe pot on StoveTop over medium-high. Brown lamb shanks 2–3 minutes per side; remove.
Add 2 tablespoons oil if needed. Add sliced onions and a pinch of salt; cook 10–12 minutes until deep golden. Add minced garlic; cook 1 minute.
Stir in 3 tablespoons rogan josh spice blend and 1 teaspoon garam masala; toast 30 seconds.
Add 1 cup crushed tomatoes and 3 cups water; scrape the bottom. Return lamb shanks and bring to a simmer.
Cover and transfer to Oven; braise at 160°C (320°F) for 2–2.5 hours until tender, turning shanks once halfway.

Near the end, make saffron pulao: Heat 1 tablespoon ghee or oil in a saucepan on StoveTop over medium. Add 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, 1 bay leaf, 2 cardamom pods, 1 small cinnamon piece, and 2 cloves; sizzle 30 seconds.

Add drained rice; stir to coat 1 minute. Add 2 cups water, 1 teaspoon salt, and the saffron water. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to low; cook 12 minutes. Rest off heat, covered, 10 minutes; fluff.
Make kachumber: In a bowl combine diced tomato, cucumber, and sliced red onion with chopped mint, a big squeeze of lemon, salt, and pepper. Toss and chill.
Finish lamb: Remove pot from Oven. Skim excess fat. If the sauce is thin, simmer uncovered on StoveTop 5–10 minutes to thicken. Stir in 1/2 cup yoghurt off heat until smooth; adjust salt.
Warm poppadoms per pack guidance (quick fry or dry heat) if using.
Serve lamb shanks over saffron pulao with extra sauce. Add kachumber on the side and poppadoms for crunch.
